name: Name
help_a1: Any questions or problems that you may have feel with all the confidence of sending us an email detailing your doubt, it will be a pleasure to help you at any time!
help_q2: I want to know about the basic concepts of the crypto currency market
help_a2_1: There are some basic concepts that you will need to know to be able to understand what is crypto currency and how it works.
help_a2_3: Transactions that have been confirmed since the start of a cryptocurrency creation are stored in a public ledger. Don't worry about your identity because it will be encrypted in your transaction, and the system will take care of your information integrity using some cryptographic techniques.
help_a2_5: Transaction is the process in which you pass funds from one digital wallet to another. This transaction will be submitted to a public ledger mentioned before and waits for confirmation.
help_a2_7: And the proccess in which transactions are confirmed and added to a public ledger is called Mining.
help_q3: Why should I use crypto currency?
help_a3: All types of crypto currency such as Bitcoins or Ethereum can be used to buy merchandise without compromising your security because it will be anonymous, you can also transfer funds to another of your existing wallets or pass them to your friends or family. besides, the payment method is easier and cheaper because the crypto currency is not tied to any country or subject to regulation.
help_q4: The crypto currency market is dangerous?
help_a4: The digital wallet in which you will have your crypto currency is not going to be directly tied to you as a subject, but the transaction will always be publicly available in the blockchain, and crypto currency exchanges require information about their users, but afterall your identity will be encrypted in the transaction.
help_q5: The crypto currency is attach to a specific government law?
help_a5: No, crypto currencies are not tied to any government because is used outside any banking or institution government and is exchanged over the internet.
help_a6: First of all a digital wallet is where all your crypto currencies will be stored that's why it's called a wallet, you can have two types of digital wallets one is called a 'hot storage wallet' and the other one is called 'cold storage wallet' the difference between this two types of wallet is that the hot storage wallet is always having communication with the internet and the cold storage wallet is not always connected to the internet this one can be in a hard-drive stored in a safe place and will only connect when you want to make a transaction.

portfolio_tutorial1: This is the sidebar, where you can scroll through the different options of the application.
portfolio_tutorial2: In Portfolio you can see your current balance for each currency.
portfolio_tutorial3: In Wallet you can make transactions such as sending or receiving coins.
portfolio_tutorial4: In Contacts you can have control of the people you want to handle in your application.
portfolio_tutorial5: In Transactions you can verify the movement of your transfers.
portfolio_tutorial6: In Settings you can control the behavior of your application, through languages or themes.
portfolio_tutorial7: If you need help, you can check the Help screen at any time.
portfolio_tutorial8: This is your graph, </br> here you can see reflected </br> the changes </br> depending on the </br> balance of your coins.
portfolio_tutorial9: This is your list of coins, inside you can see a card with your current balance and its corresponding percentage.
portfolio_tutorial10: Each card is a different currency, </br> where you can see your current funds and your percentage.
wallet_tutorial1:
This is the Wallet screen.
Here all the currencies of your application will be saved.
wallet_tutorial2: Each image represents a specific currency, within it you can perform certain transactions.
walletmodal_tutorial1: Enter the address of the person to whom you wish to transfer.
walletmodal_tutorial2: Or if you want you can select an existing contact.
walletmodal_tutorial3: Enter the amount of coins you will send.
walletmodal_tutorial4: Select the amount of fee </br> you will pay for your transaction.
walletmodal_tutorial5: You can send the amount you selected to the address you entered.
walletmodal_tutorial6: If you want you can receive coins from someone else.
walletmodalcontacts_tutorial1: You can filter your contacts by name or by the address.
walletmodalcontacts_tutorial2: All of your contacts will be shown in this table, but keep in mind that only the contacts of the currency you selected will be displayed.
walletmodalcontacts_tutorial3: You can select the contact's address by pressing this button.
walletmodaladdresses_tutorial1: These are the addresses you have available.
walletmodaladdresses_tutorial2: You can generate a QR code only by clicking on the row of the address to which you want to receive the coins.
walletmodaladdresses_tutorial3: This is the table where the addresses you have available for the currency you selected will be displayed.
walletmodaladdresses_tutorial4: You have the option to search by address or by type of address.
walletmodaladdresses_tutorial5: If you need a new address, connect CYPHER </ br> and generate a new address.
walletmodalgenerate_tutorial1: Provide a description for the address you will generate to make it easy to identify.
walletmodalgenerate_tutorial2: Select the type of address that will be.
contacts_tutorial1:
This is the Contacts screen,
where you can control the people you want to keep for future transfers.
contacts_tutorial2: If you need to search your contacts, you can do it by name or address.
contacts_tutorial3: Your contacts will be presented in this table, showing their corresponding information.
contacts_tutorial4: You can edit an existing contact.
contacts_tutorial5:
Or you can delete it.
Once the contact has been deleted, it can not be recovered.
contacts_tutorial6: You can add a new contact at any time.
addcontact_tutorial1: First you must assign a name to your contact.
addcontact_tutorial2: Then copy the address of the currency that your contact will have.
addcontact_tutorial3: And finally, select the currency to which your contact will belong.
addcontact_tutorial4: You can add your contact for future transfers.

This is the Transactions screen,
Here the transfers that have been made will be handled.
transaction_tutorial2: In this table will be shown the records of all the transfers that have been made.
transaction_tutorial3: If you want to sort the table in ascending or descending order, you can do it by clicking on any column.
transaction_tutorial4: In case you need a specific search you can do it from the search filter.
advancedfilter_tutorial1: You will have several options to filter.
advancedfilter_tutorial2: You can select the currency with which the transfer was made.
advancedfilter_tutorial3: The year in which the transfer was made.
advancedfilter_tutorial5: Or in the case of needing an accurate search, you can search by the exact date.
advancedfilter_tutorial6: If you need to restart the search, just click here. </br> This will also reset the fields.

This is the Settings screen,
here you can manipulate certain aspects of the application.
settings_tutorial2: You can change the language </br> depending on your preference.
settings_tutorial3: You can also modify the </br> theme of the application.

name: Nombre
help_a1: Cualquier duda o problema que pueda tener sientase con la confianza de enviarnos un correo electrónico detallando su duda, será un placer ayudarle en cualquier momento.
help_q2: Quiero saber sobre los conceptos basicos de el mercado de la cripto moneda
help_a2_1: Hay algunos conceptos básicos que necesitará saber para poder entender qué es el mercado de la cripto moneda y cómo funciona.
help_a2_3: Las transacciones que se han confirmado desde el inicio de una creación de criptomoneda se almacenan en un libro contable público. No se preocupe por su identidad porque se cifrará en su transacción, y el sistema se encargará de la integridad de su información mediante algunas técnicas criptográficas.
help_a2_5: La transacción es el proceso en el que transfiere fondos de una billetera digital a otra. Esta transacción se enviará a un libro público mencionado anteriormente y esperará la confirmación.
help_a2_7: Y el proceso en el que las transacciones se confirman y añaden a un libro público se denomina Minería.
help_a3: Todos los tipos de moneda cifrada como Bitcoins o Ethereum se pueden usar para comprar mercancía sin comprometer su seguridad porque será anónima, también puede transferir fondos a otra de sus billeteras existentes o pasarlas a sus amigos o familiares. además, el método de pago es más fácil y más barato porque la moneda criptográfica no está vinculada a ningún país ni está sujeta a regulación.
help_q4: ¿El mercado de la cripto moneda es peligroso?
help_a4: La cartera virtual en la que usted tendrá sus cripto monedas no estará directamente vinculado a usted como sujeto, pero la transacción siempre estará públicamente disponible en el blockchain, y los intercambios de cripto monedas requieren información sobre sus usuarios, pero después de todo su identidad será encriptada en la transacción.
help_q5: ¿Las cripto monedas estan sujetas a algun tipo de ley gubernamental?
help_a5: No, las criptomonedas no están vinculadas a ningún gobierno porque se usan fuera de cualquier gobierno bancario o instituto y se intercambian a través de Internet.
help_a6: En primer lugar, una billetera digital es donde se almacenan todas sus cripto monedas, por eso se llama billetera, puede tener dos tipos de billeteras digitales, una llamada 'billetera de almacenamiento en caliente' y la otra se denomina 'billetera de almacenamiento en frío'. La diferencia entre estos dos tipos de billetera es que la billetera de almacenamiento en caliente siempre está teniendo comunicación con Internet y la billetera de almacenamiento en frío no siempre está conectada a Internet. Puede guardarse en un disco duro en un lugar seguro y solo conectarse cuando quiera hacer una transacción.
connect_device: Algo salio mal! Porfavor revise la conexión de su dispositivo!

portfolio_tutorial10: Cada tarjeta es una moneda diferente, </br> en ellas podrá ver sus fondos actuales y su porcentaje.
